other_tests.findings: Sinus rhythm, biatrial abnormalities, and right ventricular hypertrophy.

Thickened mitral-valve leaflets, commissural fusion, thickened subvalvular structures, severe mitral stenosis (mitral-valve area measured by 2-dimensional planimetry, 0.6 cmÂ²; peak/mean transmitral pressure gradient, 47/27 mmHg), severe resting pulmonary hypertension (tricuspid regurgitant jet velocity, 3.9 m/s; peak pressure gradient, 63 mmHg), left atrium anteroposterior dimension of 35 mm.
Abundant granules in foamy macrophages and interstitial spaces that were positive for periodic acid-Schiff stain and diastase sensitive.
